programme.title: Child's Play 3
programme.desc: Chucky the killer doll wreaks havoc when he is mailed to his young foe's (Justin Whalin) coed military school.

programme.title: Howie Mandel Presents: Howie Mandel at the Howie Mandel Comedy Club
programme.desc: After being a mainstay on the comedy circuit for 40 years, Howie takes the stage at the comedy club that bears his name in Atlantic City for his first stand up comedy special in over 20 years.

programme.title: Die Another Day
programme.desc: James Bond (Pierce Brosnan) teams with a beautiful agent (Halle Berry) to battle a terrorist and a businessman (Toby Stephens) bent on world domination.

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
programme.desc: In 1981 New York, a fuel supplier (Oscar Isaac) tries to adhere to his own moral compass amid the rampant violence, corruption and decay that threaten his family and his business.

programme.title: Another 48 HRS.
programme.desc: Slick jailbird Reggie (Eddie Murphy) hits the street with sloppy policeman Jack (Nick Nolte), this time to nab a drug king.

programme.title: Alex Cross
programme.desc: In Detroit, a cunning serial killer (Matthew Fox) pushes young detective and psychologist Alex Cross (Tyler Perry) to his moral and psychological limits.

programme.title: Die Another Day
programme.desc: James Bond (Pierce Brosnan) teams with a beautiful agent (Halle Berry) to battle a terrorist and a businessman (Toby Stephens) bent on world domination.

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: Two cyborgs from the future battle over the life of a teen (Edward Furlong) who will someday lead humanity against the machines.

programme.title: Inside the NFL
programme.desc: Highlights from the seventeenth week.

programme.title: Batman Forever
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader (Val Kilmer) woos a criminal psychologist, takes on a sidekick and battles Two-Face (Tommy Lee Jones) and the Riddler (Jim Carrey).

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: Batgirl joins the caped crusaders (George Clooney, Chris O'Donnell) to stop Mr. Freeze (Arnold Schwarzenegger) and Poison Ivy from wreaking revenge upon the world.

programme.title: The Boondock Saints II: All Saints Day
programme.desc: The MacManus brothers (Sean Patrick Flanery, Norman Reedus) return to Boston to avenge the murder of their priest.

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: Thieves (Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen) ponder the identity of the traitor in their midst in the violent aftermath of a failed jewelry heist.

programme.title: Another 48 HRS.
programme.desc: Slick jailbird Reggie (Eddie Murphy) hits the street with sloppy policeman Jack (Nick Nolte), this time to nab a drug king.

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
programme.desc: In 1981 New York, a fuel supplier (Oscar Isaac) tries to adhere to his own moral compass amid the rampant violence, corruption and decay that threaten his family and his business.

programme.title: Best of Showtime Boxing 2020
programme.desc: A look back at the best boxing matches from 2020.

Two British soldiers receive seemingly impossible orders during World War I. In a race against time, they must cross into enemy territory to deliver a message that could potentially save 1,600 of their fellow comrades -- including one's own brother.

programme.title: Source Code
programme.desc: A helicopter pilot (Jake Gyllenhaal) takes part in a secret government program that enables him to assume someone's identity and experience the last few minutes of that person's life.

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Joliet Jake (John Belushi) and Elwood Blues (Dan Aykroyd), brothers on a mission from God, bomb around Chicago in an old police car, reuniting their hot band.

programme.title: 21 Bridges
programme.desc: After uncovering a conspiracy, an embattled NYPD detective joins a citywide manhunt for two cop killers. When the search intensifies, authorities take extreme measures by closing all of Manhattan's 21 bridges to prevent the suspects from escaping.

programme.title: Hereditary
programme.desc: When the matriarch of the Graham family passes away, her daughter and grandchildren begin to unravel cryptic and increasingly terrifying secrets about their ancestry, trying to outrun the sinister fate they have inherited.

programme.title: The Making of: 1917
programme.desc: Oscar-winning filmmaker Sam Mendes, Oscar-winning cinematographer Roger Deakins and the cast and crew discuss the making of ``1917,'' which is about two WWI soldiers on a life-or-death mission; the film plays in real time, as one continuous shot.

Two British soldiers receive seemingly impossible orders during World War I. In a race against time, they must cross into enemy territory to deliver a message that could potentially save 1,600 of their fellow comrades -- including one's own brother.

programme.title: Out of the Furnace
programme.desc: A steelworker (Christian Bale) takes matters into his own hands when his brother (Casey Affleck) joins one of the Northeast's most-ruthless crime syndicates, then disappears.

programme.title: Gone Baby Gone
programme.desc: Two private investigators (Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan) tread dangerous ground as they scour the Boston underworld for a kidnapped child.

programme.title: A Prayer Before Dawn
programme.desc: The amazing true story of Billy Moore, an English boxer incarcerated in Thailand's most notorious prison. Thrown into a world of drugs and violence, he finds his best chance to escape is to fight his way out in Muay Thai tournaments.

programme.title: The Jesus Rolls
programme.desc: Hours after his release from prison, Jesus Quintana pairs up with fellow misfits Petey and Marie for a freewheeling joyride of petty crime and romance.

programme.title: Bride of Chucky
programme.desc: Animated by a vicious killer's spirit, a battered doll and its mate seek help from neighbors (Katherine Heigl, Nick Stabile) to regain human form.

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Joliet Jake (John Belushi) and Elwood Blues (Dan Aykroyd), brothers on a mission from God, bomb around Chicago in an old police car, reuniting their hot band.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: A man's (Tom Hardy) life unravels after he leaves a construction site at a critical time and drives to London to be present for the birth of a child conceived during a one-night stand.

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: A chauffeur (Jackie Chan) embarks on a covert mission after a tuxedo from a secret agent (Jason Isaacs) gives him extraordinary abilities.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: A decorated career Marine (Samuel L. Jackson), about to stand trial for a botched rescue mission, asks an old friend (Tommy Lee Jones) to defend him.

programme.title: Oasis: Supersonic
programme.desc: A revealing look at the meteoric rise of seminal '90s rock band Oasis, weaving never-before-seen concert footage with candid interviews and a firsthand account of the backstage sibling rivalry that threatened to destroy the band.

programme.title: Assault in the Ring
programme.desc: The 1983 junior middleweight bout between Billy Collins Jr. and Luis Resto impacts the world of boxing and changes the lives of these two athletes.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: Industrial mercenaries sabotage a project that converts water into safe energy, then frame two scientists (Keanu Reeves, Rachel Weisz) for it.

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader (Michael Keaton) saves dismal Gotham City and gorgeous Vicki Vale (Kim Basinger) from the freaky Joker (Jack Nicholson).

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Bowling buddies (Jeff Bridges, John Goodman) become involved with a multimillionaire and his family wanted by mobsters in 1990s Los Angeles.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Featuring super middleweight Vladimir Shishkin (8-0, 5 KOs) super lightweight Shohjahon Ergashev (16-0, 14 KOs) and super bantamweight Arnold Khegai (15-1-1, 10 KOs) in separate bouts. From Aug. 23, 2019.

programme.title: Seven Psychopaths
programme.desc: A struggling screenwriter (Colin Farrell) finds himself inadvertently entangled in the criminal underworld when his knucklehead friends (Christopher Walken, Sam Rockwell) abduct a mobster's beloved Shih Tzu.

programme.title: Son of a Gun
programme.desc: JR, a teenage criminal, is locked up for a minor crime and forced to adapt to the harsh realities of prison life. Brendan Lynch, one of Australia's most notorious criminals, offers JR protection, but it comes with a price.

programme.title: Set Up
programme.desc: With help from a gangster, a betrayed man (Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson) seeks revenge for a heist gone wrong.

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Strangers (Kevin Bacon) threaten a former river guide (Meryl Streep), her husband (David Strathairn) and their son on a white-water rafting trip in the West.

programme.title: Captive State
programme.desc: Gabriel is a young man who joins a resistance group that's fighting back against extraterrestrial occupation of Chicago. He soon finds himself under careful scrutiny from a shadowy figure who's trying to crush the rebellion and its plans for freedom.

programme.title: Cold Comes the Night
programme.desc: A motel owner and her daughter are taken hostage by a blind thief to be his eyes while he tracks down his cash.

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked assailants terrorize a young couple (Liv Tyler, Scott Speedman) in a romantic getaway to a remote cottage.

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Bowling buddies (Jeff Bridges, John Goodman) become involved with a multimillionaire and his family wanted by mobsters in 1990s Los Angeles.

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: A teen (Matthew Broderick) taps his computer into the NORAD missile-defense system and plays a video game, "Global Thermonuclear War.".

programme.title: Another 48 HRS.
programme.desc: Slick jailbird Reggie (Eddie Murphy) hits the street with sloppy policeman Jack (Nick Nolte), this time to nab a drug king.

programme.title: The Untouchables
programme.desc: Eliot Ness (Kevin Costner) and his men fight Al Capone (Robert De Niro) in Chicago during Prohibition.

programme.title: Sinister
programme.desc: A true-crime novelist (Ethan Hawke) and his family become the targets of a supernatural entity when he uses found footage to unravel the murders of his home's previous occupants.

programme.title: Inside the NFL
programme.desc: Highlights from the first week of playoffs.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Two-time Olympic gold medalist Claressa Shields battles Szilvia Szabados for the vacant middleweight belt at the MGM Grand Detroit. From March 10, 2017.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Claressa Shields takes on Nikki Adler for the world title. From Aug. 4, 2017.

programme.title: Best of Showtime Boxing 2020
programme.desc: A look back at the best boxing matches from 2020.

programme.title: Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam - Live From Dallas
programme.desc: Comics including George Willborn, Paul Mooney, Corey Holcomb and Michael Blackson perform in Texas; host Mo'Nique.

programme.title: Da Sweet Blood of Jesus
programme.desc: An anthropologist (Stephen Tyrone Williams) awakes with a thirst for blood after an assistant stabs him with a cursed dagger.

programme.title: Ganja & Hess
programme.desc: Germs from the stab of an ancient dagger turn two lovers (Duane Jones, Marlene Clark) into immortal vampires.

programme.title: Cold Comes the Night
programme.desc: A motel owner and her daughter are taken hostage by a blind thief to be his eyes while he tracks down his cash.

programme.title: Run With the Hunted
programme.desc: After landing a job with a curmudgeonly private investigator, a woman becomes determined to track down the boy who saved her life as a child and then disappeared.

programme.title: Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story
programme.desc: Based on the life of the martial artist (Jason Scott Lee) from Hong Kong who found fame as a movie star living in danger.

programme.title: The Humanity Bureau
programme.desc: In the near future, a government agency exiles unproductive members of American society to a colony known as New Eden. A caseworker soon makes it his mission to expose the bureau's secrets while also trying to save a banished woman and her young son.

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Joliet Jake (John Belushi) and Elwood Blues (Dan Aykroyd), brothers on a mission from God, bomb around Chicago in an old police car, reuniting their hot band.

programme.title: Out of the Furnace
programme.desc: A steelworker (Christian Bale) takes matters into his own hands when his brother (Casey Affleck) joins one of the Northeast's most-ruthless crime syndicates, then disappears.

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader (Michael Keaton) clashes with Catwoman (Michelle Pfeiffer) and saves gloomy Gotham City from the foul Penguin's (Danny DeVito) plot.

programme.title: The Turning
programme.desc: Kate Mandell takes a job as a nanny for two young orphans at a Gothic mansion in the Maine countryside. When strange events start to plague Kate and the siblings, she begins to suspect that the estate's dark corridors are home to a malevolent entity.

programme.title: Inside the NFL
programme.desc: Highlights from the first week of playoffs.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Andre Berto takes on Shawn Porter in a WBC welterweight eliminator, 12 rounds. From April 22, 2017 in Brooklyn, N.Y.

programme.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth
